main event: On January 3, 1963, the Davidson family observed a round, aluminum-colored object hovering over their field in Jacksonville, Florida for about 10 minutes before it shot straight up, emitting a red glow.
interesting points: The object was described as being 40-50 feet in diameter., A 13-year-old servant girl was the first to spot the object and called the rest of the family outside to see it., The family found four circular indentations in the field the next day., The Marino family, living nearby, corroborated the Davidson's sighting., A police inspector deemed the witnesses to be of good reputation and found no evidence of a hoax.
witness description: Davidson family members including children and a servant girl
